text: Anyone ever deal with this? I made some updates to my HubSpot landing pages for my Google Ads and now *all* my ads have been pulled due to “malicious software”??

Please how do I use scope_css to create a hover effect on text?

But when I use {% if…%}, it doesn't work.

I hope this makes sense:grimacing:

Hey hey - hubl can only be written in the html section of a module. So you'll need to move your css up and slap it in a require_css block. Add a style tag then add the scope_css which will scope all your styles to this instance of the module. 

It's typically not needed but if you need to ensure this module styles differently than the other instances of it - then obviously it is :p

It looks like you're setting the bg color to hover_button. Is that a color picker? Or Boolean? If it's a color you need to drill into it with .color
What do you mean by drill into it with .color?
Module.color_field.color will return the hex value of the color

I'm also not certain if your if statements based on those color fields will ever evaluate as false. I think color fields may always default to white. So it will always have a value. I could be wrong though.
